respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: Knights of Lear's train, Captains, Messengers Soldiers, and Attendants

sp.speaker: Gloucester
sp.stage: Enter KING LEAR, CORNWALL, ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, CORDELIA, and Attendants.

l.stage: Laying his hand on his sword.
Re-enter GLOUCESTER, with FRANCE, BURGUNDY, and Attendants.
Exeunt all but France, Goneril, Regan, and Cordelia.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter GONERIL, and OSWALD, her steward.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter EDMUND, and CURAN meets him.

l.stage: Enter GLOUCESTER, and Servants, with torches.

sp.speaker: Oswald
sp.stage: Enter EDMUND, with his rapier drawn, CORNWALL, REGAN, GLOUCESTER, and Servants.

l.stage: Kent is put in the stocks.
Exeunt all but Gloucester and Kent.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: Before Gloucester's castle. Kent in the stocks.

sp.speaker: Fool
sp.stage: Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, GLOUCESTER, and Servants.

l.stage: Exeunt Lear, Gloucester, Kent, and Fool.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter KENT and a Gentleman, meeting.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Another part of the heath. Storm still.

sp.speaker: Edgar
sp.stage: The Fool runs out from the hovel.

sp.speaker: Kent
sp.stage: Enter EDGAR disguised as a madman.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 6
div.stage: A chamber in a farmhouse adjoining the castle.
Enter GLOUCESTER, LEAR, KENT, Fool, and EDGAR.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 7
div.stage: Enter CORNWALL, REGAN, GONERIL, EDMUND, and Servants.

l.stage: Enter GLOUCESTER, brought in by two or three.
Takes a sword, and runs at him behind.
Enter GLOUCESTER, led by Old Man.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Before the Duke of Albany's palace.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter, with drum and colours, CORDELIA, Doctor, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 6
div.stage: Enter GLOUCESTER, and EDGAR dressed like a peasant.

sp.speaker: Edgar
sp.stage: Enter LEAR, fantastically dressed with wild flowers.

sp.speaker: Edgar
sp.stage: They fight, and Edgar knocks him down.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 7
div.stage: A tent in the French camp. LEAR on a bed asleep, soft music playing; Gentleman, and others attending.

l.stage: Exeunt all but Kent and Gentleman.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter, with drum and colours, EDMUND, REGAN, Gentlemen, and Soldiers.

l.stage: To a Gentleman, who goes out.
Enter, with drum and colours, ALBANY, GONERIL, and Soldiers.
As they are going out, enter EDGAR disguised.
Exeunt all but Albany and Edgar.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: A field between the two camps.
Enter, with drum and colours, LEAR, CORDELIA, and Soldiers, over the stage; and exeunt. Enter EDGAR and GLOUCESTER.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter, in conquest, with drum and colours, EDMUND; LEAR and CORDELIA, prisoners; Captains, Soldiers, etc.

l.stage: Enter ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, another Captain, and Soldiers.
Enter EDGAR, at the third sound, armed, with a trumpet before him.
Enter a Gentleman, with a bloody knife.
The bodies of Goneril and Regan are brought in.
Re-enter LEAR, with CORDELIA dead in his arms; EDGAR, Captain, and others following.
